com.pfc.android.archcomponent.adapters

Class FavouriteAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<FavouriteAdapter.Holder>
      • com.pfc.android.archcomponent.adapters.FavouriteAdapter

  • public class FavouriteAdapter
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<FavouriteAdapter.Holder>
    FavouriteAdapter extends RecyclerView.Adapter

    This Adapter is in charge of the interface elements that are showing in every recycler view for the favourites fragments. Because your adapter subclasses RecyclerView.Adapter, you need to add the following methods:

    • 1.- getItemCount()
    • 2.- onCreateViewHolder(ViewGroup parent, int viewType)
    • 3.- onBindViewHolder(Holder holder, int position)

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    "%I%, %G%"
    Author:
    Ana San Juan

      • calDistance

        public double calDistance(double latPoint1,
                          double lonPoint1,
                          double latPoint2,
                          double lonPoint2)
        Method that implements Haversine Formula (from R.W. Sinnott, "Virtues of the Haversine", Sky and Telescope, vol. 68, no. 2, 1984, p. 159): http://www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/gis-faq-5.1.html

        This calc the distance between 2 points following the Haversine Formula and return the distance in meters.

        Parameters:
        latPoint1 - a double. Latitude point 1
        lonPoint1 - a double. Longitude point 1
        latPoint2 - a double. Latitude point 2
        lonPoint2 - a double. Longitude point 2
        Returns:
        the distance between two points gave in the parameters.
